channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: Bold, beautiful, and… brainy? Senior Perl roles in Malaysia, Dubai and Malta
item.description: With all the knowledge in your big, beautiful brain, it’s time to join a company that appreciates your breadth of experience. Our client provides online trading services and with offices in Dubai, Malta, and Malaysia, they’ve got the global reach that may provide the challenge you’re looking for. They know that a seasoned Perl pro is just what their team needs as they expand.

item.title: Perl Programmer Opportunity - Join a Prominent Tech Publishing Powerhouse in the Philippines
item.description: Our UK-based client is a global leader in the enterprise technology publishing industry, providing audiences worldwide with stimulating perspectives and unique news on enterprise tech that matters today and tomorrow. They are currently seeking a passionate and exceptional Perl programmer based in the Philippines to join their team.

item.title: Perl Programmer with Rust Experience - UK Remote
item.description: Are you a talented Perl programmer with Rust experience looking to work for a cutting-edge enterprise tech publisher that’s at the forefront of the industry? Look no further than our client, a renowned publisher that provides unique news and stimulating perspectives on the enterprise tech that powers businesses across the globe.

item.title: Perl and Koha
item.description: August 14-18, 2023, Helsinki, Finland

item.title: The Perl and Raku Conference 2023
item.description: July 11-13, 2023, Toronto, Canada

item.title: Open Source Development Community
item.description: I have started the creation of community for people who would like to contribute to open source but are unsure where to start to get help. We use a <a href="https://osdc.zulipchat.com/">Zulip instance for communication. I'd be glad to see you join and ask questions there.

item.title: Only internally vetted and approved Open Source libraries can be used
item.description: Part of a new series of articles on the OSDC web site. I also repost them on dev.to to make it easy to comment on then, and if you'd like to discuss the topics, I'd like to invite you to the OSDC Community. See next entry:

item.title: NICEPERL's lists
item.description:
Great CPAN modules released last week;
MetaCPAN weekly report;
StackOverflow Perl report.

item.title: All the ducks. Two twenty two
item.description: Almost identical Perl and Python solutions. Nice attempt and thanks for sharing.

item.title: Members Everywhere
item.description: Sharing the power of Python alongwith bunch of others cool solutions. Highly Recommended.

item.title: The Weekly Challenge #222
item.description: Thanks for getting the missing information and sharing the cool solutions. Keep it up great work.

item.title: Members' week
item.description: Get the special feeling and treat yourself with self explanatory solutions. Well done.

item.title: Lazy, Lazy, Lazy Again ...
item.description: Cool demo of Perl magic, thanks for sharing the knowledge with us.

item.title: Perl Weekly Challenge 222
item.description: Want a coolest Perl one-liners? This is the place you should checkout. Great work.

item.title: Perl Weekly Challenge 222: Matching Members and Last Member
item.description: Get the taste of Perl and Raku solutions in one blog post by our one of the top contributors. Keep it up great work.

item.title: Perl Weekly Challenge: Week 222
item.description: Nice and elegant one-liner in Raku along with Perl solution. You must check out.

item.title: PWC222 - Last Member
item.description: A thorough and detailed analysis of the task. You really don't want to miss it. Keep it up great work.

item.title: PWC222 - Matching Members
item.description: Don't you love the question section? My favourite always. Quick and easy solutions. Thank you for the contributions.

item.title: Member-ship has its Privileges
item.description: Another veteran came back and shared a quality blog post. Thank you for your support.

item.title: Last Number Standing
item.description: Welcome back Colin and thanks for the blog post. We all missed it. Thanks for sharing.

item.title: Checking Against My List of Members
item.description: Simple and easy to follow instructions. Keep it up great work.

item.title: Raku Members
item.description: Another week another set of Raku magics by our inhouse Raku expert. Thanks for the encouragement.

item.title: RECAP - The Weekly Challenge - 222
item.description: Enjoy a quick recap of last week's contributions by Team PWC dealing with the "Matching Members" and "Last Member" tasks in Perl and Raku. You will find plenty of solutions to keep you busy.

item.title: The Weekly Challenge - 223
item.description: Welcome to a new week with a couple of fun tasks: "Count Primes" and "Box Coins". If you are new to the weekly challenge, why not join us and have fun every week? For more information, please read the FAQ.

item.title: Cloud Provider Price Performance Comparison: Spot VMs
item.description: Please checkout the update with regard to the Spot VM pricing.

item.title: ValiDNS is useable
item.description: A very handy tool for all system administrators. This must be bookmarked.

item.title: RDAP is the new WHOIS
item.description: Nice introduction to RDAP. Thanks for sharing the knowledge.

item.title: Using Docker to Fix a Perl 5.37 Test Failure
item.description: Another gem of blog showing how Docker can be used to fix an error in Perl v5.37.

item.title: Recursive closure
item.description: Please do checkout the little refresher about closure in Perl. Incredible work.

item.title: Celebrate Perl 5.38 with Limited Edition merch!
item.description: What a treat for all Perl fans. Please do get your favourite items.

item.title: #622 - Perl v5.38 coming soon ...
item.description:
Hi there,

Finally I am back to editing the weekly newsletter. Thank you Gabor Szabo for all the supports and kind words. I would also like to thank all the weekly newsletter readers for sending the sweet message. Never thought it would affect me so much, honestly speaking.

Although I am staying away from screen most of the time, I did see lots of activities by Gabor Szabo. I wish I could help him in his work. If you are interested then you can joins Open Source Development Community and help him on Zulip.

I have been waiting for the final release of Perl v5.38. However I am very happy to see at least we got the RC2 out in public.

Do you know what is in Perl v5.38?

You can find the details in the perldelta page. For me, Corinna is going to be the highlight of the new release. However I am told not to have high expectations about it in this release. Still, I am excited to at least play with it and have fun.

I had almost forgot about participating The Perl and Raku Conference 2023 because of what I have gone through in the last few weeks and still going on. But the best part is, I have booked everything from air ticket to hotel reservations. Having said, I still have to get the slides ready for the my talk about The Weekly Challenge. If you are planning to attend the conference then please do come and see me. I would love to meet as many Perl enthusiasts as I can. I am mostly looking forward to meet the weekly challenge members. I got exactly 2 weeks time to get everything sorted before it is too late.

Last but not the least, please do checkout the blog post by Olaf Alders where he shared his encounter with Docker to fix a Perl v5.37 error.

Enjoy rest of the newsletter.
item.dc:subject: editorial
